name: Bedrock Park Tennis Courts
description: Bedrock Park Tennis Courts is a place to play pickleball in Oroville, CA. There are 2 outdoor courts. The lines are overlaid on a tennis court, so the net is a little taller than a normal pickleball net. The courts are free. Players have access to restrooms and lights.

name: Chico Pickle & Pong
description: Come play pickleball at Chico Pickle & Pong in Chico, CA! There are 11 indoor concrete courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The courts can be reserved. A one-time fee is required to play. Players have access to lights, a pro shop or equipment store, restrooms, water, youth programming, and trainers or lessons.
fees: Fee required â€” $12 drop in fee, $80 per month for unlimited open play

name: Indigo Park
description: Come play pickleball at Indigo Park in Chico, CA! There are 3 outdoor concrete courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The facility is wheelchair accessible.

name: Jim Brinson Activity center
description: Come play pickleball at Jim Brinson Activity center in Durham, CA! There are 3 indoor courts. The lines are permanent, but you'll need to bring your own net. A membership is required to play. Players have access to lights.

name: Martin Luther King Park
description: Martin Luther King Park is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Chico, CA. There are 16 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The courts are free. Amenities include restrooms, water, and lights.
